data.name: Arg.Name
data.value: Specifies the name of the application. This name is used for the shortcut name on the Start menu and is part of the name that appears in the Add or Remove Programs dialog box.

data.name: Arg.Source
data.value: Specifies the base directory for all source globbing patterns.

data.name: Arg.Target
data.value: Specifies the directory to which ClickOnce packages will be published. If a relative path is specified, it will be relative to the source directory. This directory will be automatically excluded from all source globbing patterns.

data.name: Create.Source
data.value: If not specified, defaults to the current directory.

data.name: Create.Name
data.value: If not specified, a name is inferred from the entry point assembly.

data.name: Arg.Suite
data.value: Specifies the name of the suite to which the application belongs. If specified, this determines the folder on the Start menu where the application is located after deployment.

data.name: Arg.Version
data.value: Specifies the version of the deployment. This need not be the same as the version of the application.

data.name: Create.Version
data.value: If not specified, the version number of the entry point assembly is used.

data.name: Arg.Description
data.value: Specifies a description for the application.

data.name: Arg.Publisher
data.value: Specifies the publisher of the application. This name is used for the folder name on the Start menu and is part of the name that appears in the Add or Remove Programs dialog box.

data.name: Create.Publisher
data.value: If not specified, a publisher is inferred from the entry point assembly.

data.name: Error.HelpTextNotFound
data.value: Help text not found for key '{0}'.

data.name: Arg.Assemblies
data.value: Specifies a comma-separated list of globbing patterns to match assemblies to be included.

data.name: Arg.CertificatePassword
data.value: Specifies the certificate password.

data.name: Arg.CertificateSource
data.value: Specifies the source of the certificate to use for signing. If omitted, the ClickOnce package will not be signed. Must be either be a path to a .pfx file, or stored certificate in the form Type\StoreName\CommonName, e.g. 'User\My\Certificate'.

data.name: Arg.CreateDesktopShortcut
data.value: Specifies whether a shortcut to the application should be added to the user's desktop'. Has no effect if LaunchMode is 'url'.

data.name: Arg.Culture
data.value: Specifies the culture of the application.

data.name: Arg.DataFiles
data.value: Specifies a comma-separated list of globbing patterns to match data files to be included.

data.name: Arg.DeploymentUrl
data.value: Specifies the deployment and update location for the application. Required if UpdateMode is any value other than 'off'. Must be a fully qualified URL or UNC path.

data.name: Arg.EntryPoint
data.value: Specifies the application assembly that starts when the application is run.

data.name: Arg.ErrorUrl
data.value: Specifies the URL of the web page that is displayed in dialog boxes during ClickOnce installation.

data.name: Arg.Files
data.value: Specifies a comma-separated list of globbing patterns to match non-assembly files to be included.

data.name: Arg.IconFile
data.value: Specifies the application icon file. This is used for the Start Menu and Add/Remove Programs dialog.

data.name: Arg.LaunchMode
data.value: Specifies whether the application can be launched from the Start menu, from a URL, or both. Must be one of: 'start', 'url', 'both'.

data.name: Arg.MinimumVersion
data.value: Specifies the minimum version the user must update to when starting the application. Has no effect is LaunchMode is 'url' or UpdateMode is 'off'.

data.name: Arg.OsVersion
data.value: Specifies the minimum required operating system (OS) version required by the application. For example, the value '5.1.2600.0' indicates the operating system is Windows XP.

data.name: Arg.PackageMode
data.value: Specifies which manifests to create. Must be one of 'application', 'deployment', 'both'.

data.name: Arg.Platform
data.value: Specifies the target platform of the application. This parameter can have the following values: 'AnyCPU', 'x86', 'x64', 'Itanium'.

data.name: Arg.SupportUrl
data.value: Specifies the URL of the web page that is displayed in the Add or Remove Programs dialog box for the application.

data.name: Arg.TargetFramework
data.value: Specifies the target framework of the application. Only .Net Framework targets net20 through to net48 are valid.

data.name: Arg.TrustInfo
data.value: Specify trust information. Must be one of: 'full', 'intranet', 'internet', or a path to an XML file containing custom trust info.

data.name: Arg.TrustUrlParameters
data.value: Specifies whether URL query-string parameters should be made available to the application. Has no effect if LaunchMode is 'start'.

data.name: Arg.UpdateMode
data.value: Specifies how application updates should be deployed. Must be one of 'off', 'starting', 'started', or a number of hours, weeks or days (e.g. '1w'). Only one unit can be specifed, and the interval cannot describe more than 1 year, regardless of unit.

data.name: Arg.UseApplicationTrust
data.value: Specifies which manifest should be used for trust decisions. If true, the Product, Publisher, and SupportUrl properties are written to the application manifest; otherwise, they are written to the deployment manifest.

data.name: Arg.UseDeployExtension
data.value: Specifies whether the .deploy file name extension mapping is used. If this parameter is true, every program file is published with a .deploy file name extension. This option is useful for web server security to limit the number of file name extensions that must be unblocked to enable ClickOnce application deployment.

data.name: Create.Culture
data.value: If not specified, the culture of the entry point assembly is used.

data.name: Create.EntryPoint
data.value: If not specified, the source directory is recursively searched for managed executables. If exactly one is found, it will be assigned to be the entry point.

data.name: Create.IconFile
data.value: If not specified, a default icon is used.

data.name: Create.OsVersion
data.value: If not specified, the value is inferred from the target framework.

data.name: Create.Platform
data.value: If not specified, the target platform will be inferred from the entry assembly. Note, setting this value can cause ClickOnce validation errors if the specified value does not match the entry assembly, therefore it is recommended to leave this option unset.

data.name: Create.TargetFramework
data.value: If 'none' is specified, a bootstrap executable will be created to launch the application.

data.name: Arg.Quiet
data.value: Displays only minimal information when the ClickOnce package is built.

data.name: Arg.Verbose
data.value: Displays extra information when the ClickOnce package is built.

data.name: Banner
data.value: ClickOnce packager Copyright 2020 Andrew Mansell See license text for details (MIT)

data.name: Build.Args
data.value: Using the following project values:

data.name: Build.Exceptions.NoEntryPoint
data.value: Unable to infer entry point, no .exe files found

data.name: Build.Verbose
data.value: Verbose logging enabled

data.name: Glob.DataFiles

data.name: Glob.EntryPoint
